title: Minister of Foreign Affairs on working visit to Khartoum
text: Minister of Foreign Affairs and National Community Abroad, Mr Ramtane Lamamra, started Friday, in his capacity as special envoy of President of the Republic Abdelmadjid Tebboune, a two-day working visit to Sudan, with on the agenda several meetings with the country’s highest authorities.Arrived this morning in Khartoum, Mr Lamamra was welcomed at the international airport by his Sudanese counterpart Mrs Mariam Sadek al-Mahdi, with whom he had introductory exchanges as a prelude to their working session and meetings with the country’s highest authorities, Chairman of the Sovereignty Council General Abdel Fattah Al-Burhan, as well as Prime Minister Mr Abdallah Hamdok.This visit is part of the two countries’ joint efforts to give fresh impetus to the bilateral cooperation in all fields and to further strengthen the tradition of consultations and coordination on regional and international issues of common interest, notably the tensions in Horn of Africa.On the sidelines of the official activities within the framework of his visit to Khartoum, Foreign minister was received by UN Under Secretary General for Political and Peace building Affairs Mrs Rosemary DiCarlo, also on a visit to Khartoum.The talks were about the cooperation between Algeria and the United Nations in the promotion of political and peaceful solutions to the crises and conflicts affecting peace and security, notably within the Maghreb region, Sahel-Saharan space, Africa and the Arab world.
